intro: Navarretia andicola, commonly known as the Andean navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white or purple flowers and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Navarretia andicola is known for its short growing season and is often found in meadows and slopes at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in alpine ecosystems.
